dialogues.text: Hammer. Solo eyes it jealously before pulling out his standard is automatic, which looks puny by comparison. Kuryakin eyes it with contempt. KURYAKIN (CONT’D) You want to borrow mine?

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: I am alright, pal. Kuryakin pulls out a second super high-tech pistol. He opens fire with both pistols at the same time. Single shots. All deadly accurate. Solo looks for a way out. He taps Kuryakin on the shoulder. SOLO (CONT’D) Can we get out of here? He points to the window. Kuryakin nods. SOLO (CONT’D) On three... One, two, three! He grabs a chair and runs at the window. Kuryakin follows SMASH. They’re through the window in a hail of glass and bullets.  62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPLASH. They land in the dark water below, find their bearings, and kick up towards the surface. Bullets smack the water around them as Guards fire from t windows of the building. There are more men running along dock. The two agents swim away from the pier, towards a cluster fishing and pleasure boats that are moored inside the har for the night.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: You seemed to have a little trouble in the water. Did you learn to swim late in life?

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: Actually, I won a silver at the Olympics, but holding a gun in each hand does make it more challenging. He raises his hands, revealing the two guns - you’re left thinking how could he swim at all with them? In the distance, the sound of an approaching engine. A bi motorboat with a searchlight on the front. The beam catches Kuryakin. He ducks underwater. The driver accelerates and in seconds the boat has reache where Kuryakin is swimming. The DRIVER cuts the motor and boat floats silently. The men scan the water on the starb side, where they last saw Kuryakin. The boat has cut the two men off from one another. Kuryakin floats as still as he can, ducking under wheneve the spotlight passes over him. Solo treads water on the other side of the boat, watching He can hear the voices of the Guards, talking to each oth in Greek. One of the Guards takes something out of a bag. Tosses it into the water. KABOOM! A grenade. Even on the other side of the boat, Solo is pummeled by t shock-wave. Kuryakin is hit full force. He clutches his ears in agony  63. The guard tosses another grenade in for good measure. Kab Kuryakin is rocked by another shock-wave. The men on the boat scan the water, they find something w the spotlight beam. The engine starts and they move towards it. It’s Kuryakin shoe. Satisfied that their job is done, they move off. And sure enough, Kuryakin has blacked out and is sinking. Slowly, slowly he drifts down towards the ocean floor. Then Solo is there, grabbing him under the arms and kicki up to the surface.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: Come on, come on. He slaps Kuryakin. Twists his nose. Nothing. Finally, he’ forced to give him mouth-to-mouth. Kuryakin sputters awake.

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: Okay! I’m okay!

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: You don’t look so okay. We’ve got to get out of here Mr. Olympics, can you swim? Kuryakin nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaby is putting the finishing touches on her makeup. She wears a beautiful dress and looks stunning. Solo sits at the desk, fiddling with some kind of electro device. Kuryakin is on the phone. He hangs up, looks at Gaby and Solo.

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: Alexander’s chauffeur is waiting for you downstairs. Solo shakes his head.  64.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: I don’t know about this... After last night’s debacle, they’1l be suspicious of everyone. He glares at Kuryakin.

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: I’m not the one who set off the alarm, Cowboy.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: I’ve told you there was no alarm on the vault. Obviously they found the door someone had kicked in!

dialogues.speaker: GABY
dialogues.text: Are you two really going to do this again? That shuts Solo and Kuryakin up. GABY (CONT’D) Our best shot is to continue as if nothing has changed. Which means, I need to go and have my lunch with Alexander and accept his job offer. The two men look at each other, they know she’s right.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: I'll fit you with a homing device just in case. Solo shows her the device he’s been fiddling with. It loo like a metal lighter. SOLO (CONT’D) Latest technology. Ten mile radius. Two day battery. And it’1l light your cigarette. He flicks it to demonstrate. SOLO (CONT’D) Flick it the other way and it sends a distress signal. We’1ll be there in a matter of minutes. He looks at Kuryakin, expecting some reaction. Kuryakin j nods.

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: Impressive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you later then. Solo walks her to the door.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: We'll be close by.

dialogues.speaker: GABY
dialogues.text: I know. 65. She takes his hands in hers, squeezes them, then she leav Solo turns to Kuryakin.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: I'm surprised.

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: By what?

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: By the fact that you didn’t feel the need to trump me with a “new and improved” Soviet tracking device. I guess you guys haven’t had a chance to steal our technology yet. Kuryakin smiles.

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: Oh, you mean one of these. He produces something that's the size of a postage stamp. KURYAKIN (CONT’D) You can hide it anywhere, twenty mile radius, four day battery. A pause as Solo takes this in.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: And you already planted one on Gaby, I suppose.

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: I sowed one into each of her dresses while she was sleeping. A bug too. He holds up a second postage stamp-size device.  66.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: Well, aren’t you Mr. Superspy. Kuryakin looks smug. EXT. ALEXANDER’S VILLA - DAY A magnificent example of mid-century modern architecture built on a massive scale. A chauffeur-driven Mercedes pulls through the gates, past ARMED GUARD patrolling with a huge Rottweiler on a leash, up the driveway to the front door. The CHAUFFEUR jumps out and opens the door for Gaby. In the fore court, half a dozen of the most stunning exot sports car of the day are parked. Ferrari, Maserati, Asto Martin, Alfa Romeo. Gaby is irresistibly drawn to them, examining them each, one-by-one.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Take your pick. He walks over to her.

dialogues.speaker: GABY
dialogues.text: Funny.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: I’m serious. Come and work for me, and you can choose any one of these you like. He turns.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now, I hope you’re hungry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kuryakin and Solo are watching through binoculars. The villa below stands on its own, surrounded by woodland Kuryakin has set up his surveillance equipment in the bac a van, and is pointing an antenna down towards the villa.  67. The scanning device is on, a single dot is pulsing on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: Looks okay.

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: I told you.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: Since you have everything so nicely in control, you can handle the surveillance. I’m going to pay the sister a visit, see what I can find out from her. Solo pulls his moped out of the back of the van, and leav Kuryakin adjusts his equipment, puts on a pair of headpho and adjusts some more.

dialogues.speaker: GABY
dialogues.text: (through the headphones) H##@o Un*** R##i. It’s too garbled to hear properly. Kuryakin slings the receiver over his shoulder, grabs the antenna, and starts down the hill to try to pick up a better signal.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. ALEXANDER’S VILLA - VERANDA - DAY Uncle Rudi is sitting at the lunch table. Alexander galla pulls a chair out for Gaby.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE RUDI
dialogues.text: Did he offer you a car?

dialogues.speaker: GABY
dialogues.text: And there I was feeling all special.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE RUDI
dialogues.text: Oh, he doesn’t do it to everyone, but I had a feeling he’d make an extra effort for you. Good afternoon my child. I can’t stay long, just here to say hello, and get you started.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Wine?  68. Alexander pours wine for everyone, then raises his glass toast.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: To conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's on the phone dressed in a gi, she’s looking all pou and rude, clearly in business mode.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: If you can’t buy them out, burn them out. She looks up at Solo, who has just been brought in by an ASSISTANT. Solo gestures - should he wait outside? She shakes her he and points to a chair.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stay where you are. (on phone) Not you Toni. She looks at Solo provocatively, never taking her eyes of him, while she carries on with the threats on the phone. ELENA (ON PHONE) (CONT’D) I get what I want Toni, it’s up to them which way it happens. Painless or painful, it’s happening... Make that eloquent. I want that dock, I am going to have that dock. Now either you're going to get it done, or I am, and if it’s going to be me, there really isn’t much need for you is there? She gently puts the phone down.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: Bad time?

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: Just another day at the office. I didn’t think you’d have the bits to turn up.  69.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: Do I need bits?

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: Bits are a prerequisite. The changing room is through there.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: I was hoping to keep my clothes on and just be a tourist.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: I think we both know you’re more inquisitive than that.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: I'm a beginner.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: Don’t worry, I’ll go easy on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solo is now dressed in a gi. He enters a small private ro with mats covering the floor. Elena is waiting.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: So, this is a family tradition?

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: My father started it. She points to an old black-and-white photograph on the wa of a powerful looking Achilles Skorpios, standing proudly the deck of his fishing boat.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He, as you might have gathered, was obsessed with the Spartan way. You can trace our family tree back two thousand years. He took it very seriously. My dad didn’t do weak, and wouldn’t let us do it either.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: So I gather.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: Ready?  70.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: You promised to go easy on me.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: Indeed, I promised. Dimitri! An ogre of a man enters. He is wearing a gi.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Max, this is Dimitri. Solo puts two-and-two together.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: I think there’s been a misunderstanding.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: I thought you wanted a lesson?

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: I thought it was with you.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: You said you were a beginner. I only teach the advanced class. Elena turns to leave.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’d love to stay and watch but I’m rather busy today. She exits, leaving Solo to face the ogre.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. ALEXANDER’S VILLA - WOODS - DAY Kuryakin is almost at the fence of the estate. He ducks behind a tree, avoiding being seen by a second GUARD walk across the lawn with another Rottweiler. He tries the headphones again, adjusts the antenna.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: (through headphones) Does that mean....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. ALEXANDER’S VILLA - VERANDA - DAY Alexander pours more wine.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: «+. you will accept my offer?

dialogues.speaker: GABY
dialogues.text: I will accept your offer, but it must include certain requisites.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Go on.

dialogues.speaker: GABY
dialogues.text: I want to see my father, and I want to be a part of what he is doing.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE RUDI
dialogues.text: I told you, she’s one of us.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: What reason do you have for thinking that I know anything about your father? Other than what Rudi has told me.

dialogues.speaker: GABY
dialogues.text: The same reason that I know who broke into your laboratories last night.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: This wine agrees with you. Are you going to tell me something interesting?

dialogues.speaker: GABY
dialogues.text: My “fiancee” is a KGB agent, and he thinks you’re up to no good, Mr. Alexander Skorpios, and so do a lot of other people. She takes out the device Solo gave her, and places it on table.

dialogues.speaker: GABY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He’s tracking me as we drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. ALEXANDER’S VILLA - WOODS - DAY Ilya listens in horror.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. ALEXANDER’S VILLA - VERANDA - DAY

dialogues.speaker: GABY
dialogues.text: He’s been teamed with a CIA agent. You know him as Max Holstein, of Texas Oil. You should be flattered gentlemen, you have managed to do what nobody else could, ally the superpowers.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Why are you telling me this?

dialogues.speaker: GABY
dialogues.text: Please, you know who my father is, and Uncle Rudi’s been grooming me since I was a child. We share the same beliefs Mr. Skorpios. I just think your views may be a little more liberal than mine. Alexander looks at Rudi. Rudi nods, stands, and walks out room.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Before we go any further, you need to understand something. Rudi has gone to fetch his photo album. It’s very important that you look very carefully at the pictures in this book. As they say, “a picture is a thousand words.” Rudi returns with the book and presents it to Alexander. Alexander opens it, and shows it to Gaby. He studies her, looking for a reaction.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your “Uncle” Rudi is a man of considerable hidden talents. Rudi shrugs modestly.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: .+-which he has gone to great trouble to document.  73. Gaby cannot hide her horror as she stares at her godfathe

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Our friends, we treat like family, but our enemies... Am I making myself clear? There is a pause, then Gaby looks up and deep into his ey

dialogues.speaker: GABY
dialogues.text: As a river of gin. Just give me an opportunity to demonstrate my loyalty to the cause. Alexander and Rudi share a look.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: (to Rudi) Isn't the CIA agent having lunch with my sister right now?

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE RUDI
dialogues.text: He is.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Then don’t you have a call to make? Rudi leaves, Alexander turns to Gaby.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It seems your father is having some doubts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dimitri has Solo in a choke hold. His face is turning red twists and pushes, and just manages to get out of it. Dimitri whacks Solo on the side of the head. He goes down hard. The ogre lumbers over to him and grabs him by the scruff the neck. That’s when Solo strikes. Kick to the balls. One, two pun and Dimitri collapses. Solo heads out the door and straight for...  74.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She’s on the phone. Solo stands before her.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: Really? How interesting. I shouldn't have any trouble handling that. She hangs up and smiles at Solo.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: I think I may be ready for the advanced class after all.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: There’s more to you than meets the eye, Max. She pours some water from a carafe into a glass for Solo. drains it in one.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: Shall we get on with it?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. ALEXANDER’S VILLA - WOODS - DAY Kuryakin hauls his gear through the trees, heading up the hill, towards the van. Then he hears it, the unmistakable sound of large animals running through the undergrowth. He looks back to see two Rottweilers bounding towards him starts to run.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. ALEXANDER’S VILLA —- COURTYARD - DAY Alexander ushers Gaby into a waiting helicopter which tak flight. Rudi, in the meantime, gets into his Mercedes, which roar off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. ALEXANDER’S VILLA - WOODS - DAY Kuryakin runs. Here come the dogs. Kuryakin stops. He kno he can’t outrun the them. As they leap at him, he swings heavy receiver, and catches one of the dogs on the side o the head, stunning it. The other goes for his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solo and Elena circle each other. Solo’s starting to look bit wobbly.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: I must commend you on your choice of drug. I thought I detected a trace of alfonsiamonoitrate in my water. I can only imagine that within the next few minutes I'll be no good to anyone.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: I did warn you that advanced is a whole new level. Solo stumbles.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But I will go easy on you. She slowly reaches out and pushes him gently on the nose. Solo collapses.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. ALEXANDER’S VILLA - WOODS - DAY Kuryakin is still wrestling with the dog. He hears the sh of men approaching. He looks over to see a GUARD aiming a rifle at him. Kurya Manages to roll over so that the dog takes the bullet. It let’s go of him with a yelp. Kuryakin manages to scram the rest of the way up the hill. He jumps into the van and screeches away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solo wakes up to find himself in what looks like a surger Elena is gone. He is strapped to a gurney and Uncle Rudi standing over him. There’s a glass window in one wall, through which Solo can see two MEN standing guard.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE RUDI
dialogues.text: Once upon a time there was a little boy. You wouldn’t describe him as a particularly special little boy, he was neither tall or handsome, charismatic or amusing. In fact, he appeared to be exceedingly dull. Because of this boy’s apparent shortcomings, he was bullied mercilessly and relentlessly by the other children. Year merged with miserable year, as life continued to be a living hell. But what the other boys didn’t understand about their victim, is that he didn’t see them as enemies. He saw them as instruments of learning. A priceless lesson was gleaned from his tormentors. Man has only two masters in this world. And their names, Mr. Solo, are pain and fear. As the boy grew older, he found he had an extraordinary talent for eliciting these gods in others. So, on the principle of playing to your strengths, he decided to make their cultivation his life’s work. Fortunately for this boy, history presented an unprecedented opportunity, a world war. You may have heard of the Dark Angel of Ravensberg, the Butcher of Belsen, or my favorite, the Fifth Horseman, Doctor Apocalypse. What history has failed to relate is that this was not three individuals, but the tireless work of a single artist. Rest assured that you are in experienced hands, and trust me, when I say, Mr. Solo, you will tell me the truth. But we can take our time, there is no hurry...  77.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: That’s quite a story. And I appreciate the trouble you’ve gone to on my account, but I fear your talents may be wasted, as I’m perfectly happy to tell you whatever you want to know. My name is Fredrick Johnson, I ama freelance industrial spy, I steal technology from corporations and sell it to the highest bidder. The German smiles, and nods to an ASSISTANT who is hoveri in the background. All of a sudden, Solo is jolted into a spasm of extraordi proportions. After five seconds it stops and smoke starts rise from his hair.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE RUDI
dialogues.text: While you were resting, I took the liberty of inserting some electrodes into the nerve center at the base of your spine, hurts doesn’t it? Shall we start again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down the street from the entrance to the offices, is a separate street entrance to the Spartan Boxing Academy. Kuryakin pulls over and parks the van. He opens his briefcase, takes out several clips of extra ammunition, which he loads into his pockets. He gets out the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kuryakin walks in. There’s a THUG manning the reception d

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: I'd like to join your gym. The receptionist eyes him sullenly, says something unintelligible in Greek.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: No Ingleesh.  78. We see Kuryakin’s hand go behind his back, in what we kno the signature position for the “KGB Kiss.” Close on: Kuryakin’s hands. We see one fly out, and hear sound of the slap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The torture continues. Another jolt. More smoking hair.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE RUDI
dialogues.text: Mr. Solo, I don’t think you took me very seriously. In the background, through the window, we see Kuryakin sh and generally dispose of the two GUARDS. The glass is sou proof. Solo can see Kuryakin in the background and watches the Guards drop, he tries not to give away his relief. Rudi turns as his Assistant wheels over a table full of instruments of torture, but is too distracted to notice t the Guards are no longer standing outside the window.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE RUDI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It does continue to amaze me, that people think I can’t spot a lie... He flicks the switch himself. Solo is jolted again. Kuryakin, who is crouched down, opens the door and slips The Assistant turns, and is shot dead, the sound of his falling body is masked by the sound of the electricity. Rudi turns the power off. UNCLE RUDI (CONT’D) Pass me the pliers, the show is about to begin. Rudi’s hand goes out and receives nothing. He then turns see Kuryakin.

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: I think we'd better get my colleague out of the chair don’t you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Rudi is now in the chair. Needless to say, he has turned quite pale. Solo’s hand hovers over the electrical switch.

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: Where’s the warhead? Rudi hesitates. Solo turns up the pain.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE RUDI
dialogues.text: Ahh... Skorpios!

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: Skorpios?

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE RUDI
dialogues.text: The family’s private island.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: And Gaby?

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE RUDI
dialogues.text: She's there too. Kuryakin looks at Solo.

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: (to Uncle Rudi) Tell him...

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE RUDI
dialogues.text: What???

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: How you know about us...

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE RUDI
dialogues.text: Gaby. (proudly) She’s one of us now.

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: Just in case you had any doubts. Annoyed, Solo jacks up the power. Rudi squeals.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: And when are the Egyptians taking delivery of the bomb?  80.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE RUDI
dialogues.text: You're too late. Solo’s hand hovers over the switch.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE RUDI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tomorrow. No more, please! Solo stares at him and steps away from the switch.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: Now tell me about your organization. Rudi looks relieved.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE RUDI
dialogues.text: At the end of the war, some of our leadership managed to escape to South America. We’ve been steadily rebuilding since then. We have more power, money, and influence than you can imagine. It doesn’t matter what happens to me or even the bomb. This is only the beginning. You can’t stop them, but you can take care of yourselves. You’re practical men, you can kill me, but you know it won’t make any difference. Let’s make a deal. I can have Swiss bank accounts set up today. Name your price. Solo’s eyebrows raise as he looks at Kuryakin.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: I have to admit that does sound like an attractive idea. What do you think? Five million each?

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: I think Ten.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE RUDI
dialogues.text: Ten million each. Done!

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: I dunno... on second thought. I think I’d rather just cook you.  81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the window, we can see a faintly out of focus Rud jolting around, but we can’t hear a sound. There’s a sound of running feet above them.

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: How are you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: Sore. Kuryakin hands Solo one of his high-tech guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solo and Kuryakin reach the narrow corridor at the top of stairs, and are immediately attacked on both sides by the Students we saw earlier, who are armed with nunchuks, swo and various martial arts weapons. They shoot a couple of them, but the sheer numbers mean t fighting soon becomes hand-to-hand. A spectacular martial arts battle ensues as Solo and Kury fight eight men at the same time. Kuryakin once again demonstrates his extraordinary martial arts skills. Solo take care of himself, but now and then needs some help fr Kuryakin. As they make their way towards the entrance, Kuryakin suddenly points at one of their would-be attackers, who a now approaching with a lot more caution.

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: You! The MAN turns tail and runs. Kuryakin goes after him.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: What are you doing?... The entrance is this way. Kuryakin grabs the Man, but three more attack him. Solo is forced to go to his aid. They’re fighting the fou attackers, but all Kuryakin appears to be interested in i the left wrist of the Man he ran after. Finally, he manages to pull his shirtsleeve up.  82.

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: Dammit! He goes bonkers, taking out his frustration on the attack Solo shakes his head in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: Your father’s watch again? This has to stop. Kuryakin storms out of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexander's helicopter flies over Skorpios Island which i C-shaped rock sticking out of the ocean. In the center of the C is a deepwater harbor, where a tan is laid up for repairs. Built into the rock, defending the harbor, is the ancient fortress. On the other side of the harbor, there is a village with thick cluster of fishing boats. There is a half mile long causeway, which joins the islan the mainland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexander’s helicopter descends into the castle courtyard three sides, there are massive stone walls, and the fourt side is the rock itself. In the middle of the fourth side, there is the bunker-lik entrance to the old German gun emplacement, which has cle been modernized and put to a different use. The helicopter lands. Alexander and Gaby climb out.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Please follow me. She does. They are lead through the heavily guarded castl a large terrace, overlooking the sea. Seated on a chair, staring out into the distance, is the Professor. Alexander grabs Gaby’s arm.  83.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Eighteen years. This is quite a moment. Gaby nods.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Remember, you have very little time. Gaby looks Alexander in the eyes.

dialogues.speaker: GABY
dialogues.text: Leave him to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaby walks out onto the terrace. Her father turns at the sound of her footsteps. He looks pale and gaunt. He rises to meet her.

dialogues.speaker: UDO, (SUBTITLE)
dialogues.text: (in German) Gaby?

dialogues.speaker: GABY, (SUBTITLE)
dialogues.text: Father. He studies her face, not entirely sure. He then takes her hand. But instead of clasping it, he turns it over lookin for something - a small scar on her wrist.

dialogues.speaker: UDO, (SUBTITLE)
dialogues.text: Oh God. It really is you. He puts his head in his hands. UDO (SUBTITLE) (CONT’D) Forgive me. As you get older you start to doubt some of your beliefs, and I think I’ve made a terrible mistake.

dialogues.speaker: GABY, (SUBTITLE)
dialogues.text: Look at me father. Take a deep breath. I need you to be strong. But he’s off in his own world of self-recrimination.

dialogues.speaker: UDO, (SUBTITLE)
dialogues.text: I was so sure I was doing the right thing.  84. Whack! Gaby slaps him across the face.

dialogues.speaker: GABY, (SUBTITLE)
dialogues.text: I need you to stop feeling sorry for yourself and listen carefully to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solo stirs uncomfortably in his seat. He’s half sitting o cushion, a failed attempt to ease some of the effect of h torture. Kuryakin sits opposite, smirking at Solo’s predicament.

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: You okay, Cowboy?

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: No, but I‘’1l manage. Kuryakin chuckles. Solo looks annoyed. Long silence. SOLO (CONT’D) I didn’t have her down as a Nazi, I missed that one.

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: I knew she was a Nazi.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Of course you did.

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: I bugged her, didn’t I?

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: Do me a favor.

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: You let her get into you, didn’t you, Cowboy? That’s never a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: You know what, Kalinka, you’re really rather sweet in a perverse, dangerous, and naive sort of way. She didn't “get into me,” the job did. I sometimes find myself chuckling at the absurdity of it all.  85.

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: Ah, Solo the philosopher.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: You should try thinking sometime, Kalinka, a wild idea for you I know.

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: What’s there to think about? I kill bad people, that’s my job. I like my job.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: It must be so comforting not to understand the concept of irony. Last week you were trying to take my life, and this week you’re doing quite a good job of saving it. Can’t wait to see what happens next week, if it turns out that I have something that you want. You don’t know if you’re coming or going.

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: I know enough to be satisfied that I'm doing the right thing.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: Is that so? Do you really think the men who give us orders care about making the world a safer place? Or do they just want to be the only kids in the playground with a gun? Hmm, I wonder.

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: It must be terribly sad not to believe in anything anymore. At that moment, the door to the cabin opens and in walks STEWARD, carrying a silver tray with three glasses on it. As he approaches, we recognize Mr. Waverly from the hotel the racetrack.

dialogues.speaker: WAVERLY
dialogues.text: Vodka for Mr. Solo? Bourbon for Mr. Kuryakin. And... He sits down next to Solo.  86. WAVERLY (CONT’D) Sherry for me. (beat) Since you two are at the disadvantage here, allow me to introduce myself, retired Admiral Percival Waverly. Currently, Deputy Head of British Naval Intelligence. Your employers send their regards. Given the latest developments, we are all in agreement that we need to stop competing, and help one another on this one. You will report to me for the remainder of the mission. You can confirm this with your bosses when we land. Down she goes. He takes a large swig of his sherry.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: What exactly are the latest developments?

dialogues.speaker: WAVERLY
dialogues.text: We have it on good authority that the Egyptians are expecting delivery of the warhead within the next twelve hours. There are rumors that they’re sending a submarine. And... there’s the small matter of retrieving our agent.

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: Your agent?

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: Here we go. I’m starting to smell the irony. She’s working for you, isn’t she?

dialogues.speaker: WAVERLY
dialogues.text: Gaby is a British agent, has been for years. There are some things too sensitive to share, even with one’s allies.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: In other words you wanted the credit for bagging the Professor for yourself.  87.

dialogues.speaker: WAVERLY
dialogues.text: Once you Americans lost her father, it was only a matter of time before his old Nazi chums would turn up. We were expecting Nazis, but we weren't expecting you two. You nearly cocked up fifteen years of our work, but we have to make do, don’t we?

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: She’s a Nazi. Solo’s buttocks can prove it, and I heard her betray us.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: I’m surprised you’re surprised. You were so sure you were right.

dialogues.speaker: WAVERLY
dialogues.text: We knew that Alexander Skorpios already had his doubts about you, Mr. Kuryakin, and your botched break-in to his headquarters only fuelled his suspicions. He looks at Solo. WAVERLY (CONT’D) Honestly, kicking in a door? Where did you learn your skills? Solo doesn’t bother to protest. WAVERLY (CONT’D) My agent was forced to denounce you, in order to maintain her own credibility and stay in the game. She knew that you’d planted a bug on her and would be listening to every word she said.

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: Except that she didn’t know about the bug. Only the transmitter, which she destroyed.

dialogues.speaker: WAVERLY
dialogues.text: Where did they send you to school my dear boy?  88.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: Go easy on him, he’s only just learning that the game he thinks he’s playing, isn’t the game he’s really playing.

dialogues.speaker: WAVERLY
dialogues.text: Do you honestly think you could plant a bug on an agent, who has been in the field for more than a week, without them knowing? There’s a ding and the “fasten seat belt” light comes on. WAVERLY (CONT’D) Now fasten up, we’re going in. Solo and Kuryakin look out of the window. Nothing but oce below them, until the plane banks and a British aircraft carrier comes into view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexander stands at a window, looking down at Gaby and he father on the terrace below. Elena enters.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Sister. They hug.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: We're almost there.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Our father would be proud.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: They’11 send an army to stop us.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: We'll give them a Spartan welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaby and her father walk along the terrace. From his expression, it’s clear that she’s told him why she’s real there.  89.

dialogues.speaker: UDO
dialogues.text: How do I know that this isn’t some kind of trick?

dialogues.speaker: GABY
dialogues.text: We'll have to trust one another won't we. Father... you must agree to complete the bomb assembly. That's the best opportunity we have to disable it once and for all. Udo thinks.

dialogues.speaker: UDO
dialogues.text: If I can substitute the neutron reflector lens... But they’1ll be watching every step of the process. My assistant Nikos, he’1l know.

dialogues.speaker: GABY
dialogues.text: Leave him to me. Father and daughter stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: UDO
dialogues.text: Thank you. I know you despise me but...

dialogues.speaker: GABY
dialogues.text: Hug me, Father. He looks surprised, until her eyes flick towards Alexande and Elena, who are walking out to greet them. Father and daughter hug awkwardly.

dialogues.speaker: GABY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My father hasn’t been feeling well. That, and the stress of the work led to a certain amount of self- doubt. However, he is now ready to resume his work.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Udo? The Professor nods.

dialogues.speaker: UDO
dialogues.text: I’m ready.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: (to Gaby) I'm impressed.  90.

dialogues.speaker: UDO
dialogues.text: I want my daughter with me. Alexander glances at Elena, who nods.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Good. I need you to finish tonight.

dialogues.speaker: UDO
dialogues.text: (to Gaby) Come, I’1l show you my laboratory. Alexander and Elena watch them walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane lands. Waverly exits, followed by Solo and Kuryakin. They are greeted by the CAPTAIN, who is surprisingly short in stature.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Good day gentlemen. I hope you understand that this is my vessel and we won’t have any issues over who is in command?

dialogues.speaker: WAVERLY
dialogues.text: Not at all Captain, understood. Now, I need to get these men to a radio.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Very well, follow me. Waverly turns to the two agents and says under his breath

dialogues.speaker: WAVERLY
dialogues.text: The Captain has a bit of a power issue, I’m sure you can understand why. It’s best you leave him to me. They are escorted inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTERCUT BETWEEN: Solo and Kuryakin are pacing as they li to their bosses on separate telephones at opposite sides the room.

dialogues.speaker: SANDERS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The Brits have the biggest naval presence in the area.  gl.

dialogues.speaker: OLEG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You'll need their firepower.

dialogues.speaker: SANDERS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But you will be leading the assault.

dialogues.speaker: OLEG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Once you’ve stopped the bomb.

dialogues.speaker: SANDERS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You must retrieve the disk...

dialogues.speaker: OLEG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Whatever it takes, the disk is fundamental.

dialogues.speaker: SANDERS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Get rid of the Russian if necessary.

dialogues.speaker: OLEG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The American will be looking for it, if he gets in your way, do what you must. Solo and Kuryakin stare at each other across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain leads Waverly, Solo, and Kuryakin inside. There's a big map on the wall of Skorpios Island and the surrounding coastline. Seated, facing it, are a dozen Special Boat Service (SBS) TROOPS. These are the British equivalent of Navy Seals. T all stand to attention.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: This is Major Jockelson and his team. They're my finest men. They will be supporting your efforts. A tough looking young man, MAJOR JOCKELSON, with a scar d his left cheek, steps forward to shake their hands. Waverly moves in front of the map.  92.

dialogues.speaker: WAVERLY
dialogues.text: Please sit down....Skorpios Island has been a fortress of some kind since the time of the ancient Greeks. The Knights Templar built a castle there in the Middle Ages, and the Germans built a massive fortified gun emplacement there during the war. Several attempts to capture it were unsuccessful. Later, Alexander's father purchased it and it has been refurbished extensively since then. We've managed to “borrow” the plans from the architect in Athens... After careful study, our conclusion is that our best approach is a stealth operation. A surprise attack by a small team of our best men. That is you gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexander stands with his HEAD OF SECURITY. They are watc a bank of primitive CCTVs, which show different sections the island: the harbor, the road up to the castle, the ga

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: I’m expecting trouble tonight. Prepare your men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A glass fronted room, full of scientific equipment and machinery, including three or four warheads on a rack, wh are off to one side. In the center, resting on a metal trolley, is the nuclear bomb casing. Udo stands over it, wearing a white lab coat. He is assembling the internal components. It’s a delicate proce involving patience and precision. There are several white coated TECHNICIANS servicing him.

dialogues.speaker: UDO
dialogues.text: Nikos? Micro-wrench. His chief assistant, NIKOS, is a slimy young man with a ferret-like appearance. He hands Udo a precision tool, wh Udo uses to secure a connection inside the bomb.  93. Gaby stands just a little too close to Nikos, watching he father work.

dialogues.speaker: GABY
dialogues.text: (to Nikos) Which part did you work on? Nikos is flustered. He’s not used to beautiful women payi attention to him.

dialogues.speaker: NIKOS
dialogues.text: Uh...well...uh.

dialogues.speaker: UDO
dialogues.text: Nikos has been part of the whole process. He’s quite brilliant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two GUARDS patrol the dock. They reach the end, and look at the dark water. Suddenly, a hole appears in each of th foreheads. One tumbles off the dock, where he is caught by two SBS Frogmen waiting below. The other crumples onto the dock. More Frogmen emerge from the dark water and secure the do Then a pair of low profile rafts are floated in, carrying and weapons. Among them are Solo and Kuryakin. The SBS team are crack troops, and they move with well-oi precision. Snipers, a Radio-man, and a RPG team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexander watches all this activity on the CCTV. He nods gravely to his chief of security.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: You know what to do. Alexander gets up and leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Udo is still working on the bomb. Gaby points to a metal attached to the side of the bomb with a red light and gre light on it.  94.

dialogues.speaker: GABY
dialogues.text: What does that do?

dialogues.speaker: NIKOS
dialogues.text: That is known as the coupler. It sends a signal which enables a second missile to lock onto this one for double the impact. Your father invented it.

dialogues.speaker: UDO
dialogues.text: Nikos? Neutron focus lens. Nikos takes the lens out of a wooden box and hands it to Professor. This is Gaby’s cue. She “accidently” brushes against a gl beaker full of a dark brown liquid, which smashes on the floor. Everyone turns to look at her, at which point the Profess slips the lens into one pocket and pulls a substitute len out of another.

dialogues.speaker: GABY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry! I’m so clumsy. I hope that wasn’t important.

dialogues.speaker: NIKOS
dialogues.text: Very important... He holds up a glass containing more of the brown liquid.

dialogues.speaker: NIKOS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Coca-cola. He takes a swig. Everyone laughs. Father and daughter glance at each other as Udo installs substitute lens.

dialogues.speaker: UDO
dialogues.text: Nikos, pay attention! Reflector wrap.

dialogues.speaker: NIKOS
dialogues.text: Yes boss. In walks Alexander. He walks up next to Gaby.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: How much longer Udo?

dialogues.speaker: UDO
dialogues.text: Almost done.  95.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Excellent. He slaps Gaby across the face, knocking her to the ground

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to guards) Take her to one of the cells. If you don’t hear from me in ten minutes, shoot her. (to Udo) Now, you have nine minutes to install the correct lens and finish the assembly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The assault team progresses up the hill, silently taking sentries with deadly precision. They are outside the main gate, where two SENTRIES stand, smoking and chatting. Jockelson signals for his men. Two silenced shots, and th down. The team is through the gates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that is when all hell breaks lose. They’ve walked str into an ambush. Shots rain down on them from all sides. There is no cover. They are sitting ducks. Jockelson signals a retreat, but there are snipers outsid gate as well. There is one open doorway across the courtyard. They have choice but to make a run for it. The team zig-zigs across the open space, using parked veh and the central well as partial cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only half the team makes it inside, the others are wounde They manage to bar the door and also the interior door, b more of the SPARTAN GUARDS arrive. The men hunker down, out of sight of the windows. There’s out.  96. A thumping is heard as the Spartan Guards start to pound doors. It won’t be long before they break through.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: (to Jockelson) You'd better radio for support.

dialogues.speaker: JOCKELSON
dialogues.text: We lost the radio... A pause while the gravity of the situation sinks in. JOCKELSON (CONT’D) (to his men) Listen up. We’re going to form a defensive position. He directs his men to turn the banquet tables on their si each facing one of the doors. Solo and Kuryakin look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: Cowboy?

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: Yes, Kalinka.

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: Alexander's mine.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: Fine. I want the sister. But first... He looks around. SOLO (CONT’D) We need to figure out a way out of here. Any hall of this period should have a stone floor, but this one is wood.

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: It doesn’t make sense, unless there’s something underneath, in which case a stone floor would be too heavy. The doors are cracking.  97. SOLO (CONT’D) We just need to get through it rather quickly.... He looks around, but Kuryakin is already striding across room, towards the Soldier carrying the RPG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As gunfire sounds above, Udo quickly closes the bomb casi Alexander looks at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: Only seven minutes. Very good. Alexander gestures to his guards. They wheel the bomb tro out of the lab.

dialogues.speaker: UDO
dialogues.text: What about Gaby?

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER
dialogues.text: You don’t need to worry about her, she'll be joining you shortly. He shoots the Professor between the eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ALEXANDER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Nikos) The disk with the Professor's research, where is it? Nikos opens a small safe and takes out the disk. Alexander grabs it and tucks it in his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Spartan Guards are almost through the inner door. Kuryakin has the RPG, and is aiming at the floorboards ac the room. Kuryakin pulls the trigger, and the rocket ploughs into t floor exploding on impact. Kuryakin is knocked off his feet and the room is filled w smoke, but as it clears, we see that a large section of t floor has been blown away, revealing a room below. Solo picks Kuryakin up, and they start down the hole, fol by Jockelson and his team.  98.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaby is seated on a stone bench. Outside the cell, one of Guards looks at his watch. Nods to the other, who starts unlock the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the men raises his gun to shoot her. Gaby closes her eyes. Ready to die. Two shots. Gaby opens her eyes to find Solo standing over her. The two Guards lie at his feet. Kuryakin and the others are behind in a fire-fight with o Guards. Solo helps her up. She’s shaking.

dialogues.speaker: I...
dialogues.text: She throws her arms around him and holds on for dear life Solo is awkward, doesn’t know what to do, but gradually h arms close around her. Kuryakin interrupts the moment.

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: The warhead. Gaby pulls herself together. Kuryakin continues down the corridor. Gaby follows.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: (to Jockelson) Find a radio and get us some help. He’s about to follow the others, when he spots something familiar about the Guard he just shot. He bends over him takes something off his left wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty. The bank of monitors flicker. Kuryakin enters, sca them, spots Alexander and Nikos passing various cars in a garage.  99.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaby, Solo, and Kuryakin enter. There’s a tunnel entrance end. Alexander’s car engine can be heard echoing back dow tunnel. There are several ATVs (lightweight SUV’s on steroids wit tires) parked in a row, and a line of dirt bikes as well. Kuryakin slings his rifle over his shoulder and jumps on bike. Solo heads for an ATV.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: (to Gaby) You drive. The ATV and the bike hurtle down the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just starting to get light out as the ATV and the bi out of what appears to be a cave in side of the rock. The splash through a foot of ocean water, and careen up onto causeway, which connects the island to the mainland. Alexander’s car is ahead in the distance. He’s in a soupe Land Rover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solo and Gaby are travelling at tremendous speed, but Ale is quite far ahead.

dialogues.speaker: GABY
dialogues.text: Do you hate me?

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: Does it matter?

dialogues.speaker: GABY
dialogues.text: What do you think? Solo smiles.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: I think you can drive better than this. The road winds as it travels uphill.  100. Gaby accelerates, taking the turns at alarming speed, but not getting any closer. Suddenly, she jams on the brakes. Reverses. There’s a dir heading up a steep slope.

dialogues.speaker: GABY
dialogues.text: Hold on tight. They bounce up the hill at tremendous speed, flying throu air as they hit bumps. But once they crest the hill the t joins the road again, and now they’re just behind Alexand Kuryakin has followed behind on his bike. Now, instead of the road, he continues across country, heading uphill to vantage point where he can see the road below. In the meantime, the road is heading into woodlands as Ga Solo close in on Alexander. Gaby bumps the back of the Land Rover. Alexander jams on brakes, trying to shake her off. It’s bumper cars until Gaby sees an opening. She accelera the bank and passes Alexander. She then swerves the ATV d front of the Land Rover, forcing it off the road and into ditch. The ATV flips and lands upside down next to the Land Rove

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kuryakin can barely see the cars through the trees. He ra the rifle and looks through the sight. Relief as he sees Solo crawl out of the ATV and pull Gaby

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikos lies nearby, also unconscious. Solo tries to help G her feet, but she yelps in pain.

dialogues.speaker: GABY
dialogues.text: I think my leg is broken.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: I’m never getting in a car with you again.  101. Whack! Alexander comes out of nowhere, knocking Solo off feet. Solo fights Alexander, but the Spartan is bigger and bett

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kuryakin tries to take a shot, but between the trees and moving bodies, he’s just as likely to hit the wrong perso

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solo is being pummeled. Alexander punches him so hard tha pretty much knocked senseless. Finally, he gets behind Solo and lifts him by the neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kuryakin tracks the action through his sight. Finger on t trigger. He gets glimpses of Alexander, but he’s blocked Solo’s body. Alexander grips Solo’s head to twist it and break his nec

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: Sorry, Cowboy. He pulls the trigger. We travel with the bullet as it flies through the air, wh past tree branches, penetrating Solo’s shoulder, travelli through his body, and out the other side into Alexander's He drops. Solo collapses beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kuryakin jumps on the bike and rides down through the tre  102.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clutching his shoulder, Solo reaches inside Alexander's jacket and snags the disk, which he pockets. He then lean back against a tree. Kuryakin arrives his bike. Hurries over to Solo. Kuryakin grins, seeing that Solo is okay.

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: Sorry I had to shoot you, Cowboy.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: Something you've been wanting to do since we met.

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: Is he dead? Kuryakin goes over to Alexander's body ostensibly to chec and surreptitiously rummages through his pockets.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: I’ve got something for you. He produces Kuryakin’s father’s watch. SOLO (CONT’D) After all that, you shot the guy who took it and didn’t even recognize him. Kuryakin’s eyes light up.

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: I love you, Cowboy! He kisses Solo on both cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: Ouch. Be gentle with me! The sound of a helicopter approaching rapidly. A British naval helicopter lands in a field just beyond the trees, Waverly steps out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A battered Solo, Kuryakin, and Gaby, whose leg in a splin watch as four MEN carefully carry the warhead over to the helicopter, and place it in the hold.  103. One of the men comes over and says something to Waverly. then walks over to the warhead, where they talk some more The sound of the helicopter drowns out what they are sayi Waverly comes over to our trio.

dialogues.speaker: WAVERLY
dialogues.text: Well, it appears we have the wrong warhead.

dialogues.speaker: GABY
dialogues.text: But it’s identical to the one...

dialogues.speaker: WAVERLY
dialogues.text: It is, only there’s no plutonium. It’s a decoy. We’ve been had. (to pilot) Let's go. Waverly gets into the front of the helicopter and starts barking orders into the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waverly finishes on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: WAVERLY
dialogues.text: They’ve searched the castle from top to bottom. Nothing. No sign of the warhead or Elena Skorpios. We've had the place locked up all night. Radar, sonar, aerial patrols, no ships have been in or out of the harbor, including submarines. But... some fishing boats left the village this morning just before dawn. The Harbor Master is being brought to the carrier to help us. Solo stares at the decoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HARBOR MASTER is standing in front of the group.

dialogues.speaker: HARBOR MASTER
dialogues.text: One hundred and twenty seven fishing boats left the village before dawn as they do every day. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: HARBOR MASTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They are now spread over a two hundred mile radius.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: We don’t know the name, let alone the location of the boat that we’re looking for. It will be impossible for us to find and search more than twenty boats in the next few hours. I simply don’t have the manpower. Solo looks up, he shuts his eyes in thought. FLASHBACK TO: The photograph he saw in Alexander's office Achilles Skorpios with his kids standing in front his fis boat. But the name is obscured. Only the middle two lette “ON” are visible. Solo thinks harder. FLASHBACK TO: A second, older picture (in gym) of Achille Skorpios as a young man standing in front of the boat. Th time only the last two letters “AS” are visible. FLASHBACK TO: Elena’s face as she says:

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: My father was obsessed with the “Spartan way.” FLASHBACK TO: The Secretary giving Solo the guided tour a she says:

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY
dialogues.text: Legend has it that the 300 Spartans used this fighting technique to defeat two thousand Persians at the battle of Thermopylae.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solo turns to the group.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: What was the name of the leader of the 300 hundred Spartans?

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: What has that got to do with anything?  105.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: Please answer the question.

dialogues.speaker: WAVERLY
dialogues.text: Leonidas. FLASH TO: The pictures of the boat. Solo fills in the mis letters, they fit perfectly.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: Leonidas is the name of the boat we're looking for. The Captain looks skeptical.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: I am afraid that’s not enough agent Solo. Waverly, I need the radio, every minute my man spends on this theory is a minute wasted in co- ordinating the broader search.

dialogues.speaker: WAVERLY
dialogues.text: Give my man a minute, Captain. The Captain huffs and puffs, and stands on his tip toes.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: One minute.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: The Harbor Master is on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: HARBOR MASTER, (SUBTITLE)
dialogues.text: (in Greek) Leonidas, come in Leonidas. This is the Harbor Master. No response, everybody exchanges looks of doubt, why does Solo think that this is the boat they have been looking f Solo holds fast and looks at a RADIO TRACKING MAN who sit near by. HARBOR MASTER (SUBTITLE) (CONT’D) Leonidas, come in Leonidas. This is the Harbor Master.

dialogues.speaker: OVER RADIO, (SUBTITLE)
dialogues.text: Harbor Master. This is Leonidas. Solo takes the radio.  106.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO, (SUBTITLE)
dialogues.text: This is Napoleon Solo. I have a message for the owner of your boat, Elena Skorpios.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a Greek FISHING CAPTAIN looking surprised.

dialogues.speaker: FISHING CAPTAIN, (SUBTITLE)
dialogues.text: Sorry, do not understand message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence, more doubt in the room. The Radio Tracking Man r his finger, he needs more time to find a position. Solo continues.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO, (SUBTITLE)
dialogues.text: The message is: earlier today I killed your brother. Silence from the radio. The Captain looks at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Your minute is up agent. I am taking control of my radio. The Russian is standing behind the diminutive captain.

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: Are you sure, Cowboy?

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: Sure enough. We see the Russian put his hands behind his back in preparation for the “KGB Kiss.” Off screen we hear it’s delivery. Solo on the radio. SOLO (CONT’D) I would like to report that he died according to the Spartan tradition, with honor and courage. But alas, this was not the case. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: SOLO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It was sadly really rather pitiful. So, I'd just like to send you my condolences. Long silence. It looks like nothing is going to happen. T the radio crackles to life.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA, (SUBTITLE)
dialogues.text: (over radio) Hello Napoleon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elena speaks into the radio.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: I appreciate the sentiment of your message, and now I hope you will appreciate the significance of mine. I want you to listen carefully, any blood relation that you still have living will be dead within the year, they will die as slowly and as painfully as possible. You already know from personal experience this is our area of expertise. You have no idea of the size and sophistication of our organization. There is nothing you can do to protect or hide them. You will be helpless to do anything but witness their suffering as you await your own death which we will save for last. This I vow on the death of my brother. She looks out the window and we see a submarine in the distance. The warhead is being lowered into a zodiac.

dialogues.speaker: BETWEEN SOLO AND ELENA.
dialogues.text: The Radio Tracking Man gives Solo the thumbs up. Waverly to a TECHNICIAN, who taps the coordinates into a computer  108.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: I am most flattered you feel so strongly about me, however, in order for that to happen don’t you first need to be able to inform your organization?

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: That will take a matter of minutes, as will the delivery of the warhead that you so desperately sought.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: I see one flaw in your logic.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: Entertain me.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Solo watches through the window as the decoy warhead is launched.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: While you’ve been busy telling me how dangerous you are, we’ve been busy locking onto your location, via your radio signal. This gave us your general location.

dialogues.speaker: ELENA
dialogues.text: Aren’t you clever? But that’s not going to help you much. I’1l be gone in five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: I haven't finished, the coupling device, that you so considerately left us on your decoy warhead, is accurate to ten feet. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: SOLO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That warhead, although not nuclear, shouldn’t have too much trouble obliterating a medium sized Greek fishing boat.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Elena, as doubt starts to creep across face.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: SOLO (CONT’D) Now, just in case you still haven't worked out exactly what’s going on, the aforementioned missile was launched forty-five seconds ago, which gives you about thirty seconds to impact. Don’t worry, it won't trigger the nuclear warhead, as that requires fission.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: At which point, Elena can see panicked members of her cre pointing up in the air and jumping overboard. SOLO (CONT’D) But I suggest you abandon ship immediately if you want to make good on your vow. (pause) How’s that for entertainment.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Elena turns white... KABOOM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solo is packing his gear into a suit case, on the bed we see the disk, on a dressing table is his gun. There is a knock at the door. Solo covers the gun with a towel and o the door. Kuryakin is standing there holding a bottle.

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: I bought you the best vodka I could find. Can’t get my head round it while there is still whiskey in the world. Can I come in?  110.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: You might as well, cause I got something for you too. He gestures to a bottle of whiskey. Solo clocks that Kuryakin has seen the disk on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: You have a couple of glasses? I could use a drink about now. Solo, goes to the dressing table where there are glasses. the mirror he can see Kuryakin looking longingly at the d Kuryakin undoes a button on his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: Why don’t you sit down? Kuryakin does so, but his hand looks like it could reach his gun. Solo gives Kuryakin his glass and smiles, he ret to his seat at the dressing table and puts his glass down the towel with the gun underneath it, he uses the drink a cover. SOLO (CONT’D) All in all, I think we made a pretty good team.

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: It seems so, I have to admit, I didn’t have a great deal of confidence in you at the beginning.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: So what now? You go back to Russia? Mission accomplished? The Russian’s eyes again flick toward the disk, and his h seems to creep inside his jacket looking for a gun. In response, Solo’s hand is creeping under the towel. The tension mounts. Suddenly, there is a knock at the door. T tension is shattered. SOLO (CONT’D) Could you get that for me? The Russian opens the door. There stands Gaby.

dialogues.speaker: GABY
dialogues.text: Thought you’d like to know, the salvage team managed to retrieve the missile’s plutonium core from the sea bed, it’s intact.  111. She notices the tension in the room.

dialogues.speaker: GABY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I hope I am not interrupting anything.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: Just a drink, and we can continue that downstairs. I have to catch a plane in an hour. There’s a release of tension.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Solo puts his bags on his chair, and checks his inside pocket, it contains the disk, he’s happy. He then attempt put his bags up into the space above his seat. He’s havin some trouble due to his injured shoulder. A hot STEWARDES helps him while people push behind.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: Thank you, young lady. He sits, sighs with relief, closes his eyes and falls asl He wakes at 30,000 feet, looks out of the window, and tap his breast pocket, a look of shock comes over him, there' nothing there. He’s been pick-pocketed. He starts frantic searching his clothes. We hear a voice off screen, it’s the Russian.

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: Looking for this? He’s holding the disk. KURYAKIN (CONT’D) I think you know what my orders are, but you know what, Cowboy? I don’t like debts. So this is for you saving my life when I was drowning. And for my father’s watch. Now we’re even. He drops it on Solo’s lap, and marches off. Moments later, the Russian is having a drink, when all of sudden, Solo drops the disk on his lap.  112.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: That's for taking out the electrodes from my behind and shooting me through the shoulder, and both times somehow saving my life. Now we're even. He walks off. He goes to the bar. The Russian approaches throws the disk on to the bar. SOLO (CONT’D) This isn’t going to work is it?

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: So you're really retiring, Cowboy? (beat) What will you do? Solo shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: Go fishing.

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: So what we just did doesn’t change anything? You don’t think we did any good at all?

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: Oh, you are sweet, Kalinka. Tell you what, the day there’s an organization that only deals with real threats, and bypasses national oneupmanship, I'll be interested.

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: So, what are we going to do with this? They look at the disk.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: Well I don’t see how it can do anyone any good do you? It’s a pity that neither of us found it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see them snap the disk in half and drop it into the toilet. They hit the flusher.  113.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: Well that’s the end of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. NEW YORK STREET —- DAY Solo is walking down a street in the East Forties. He see Del Florio’s Tailors. INT. DEL FLORIO’S TAILORS - DAY The bell dings as Solo enters and produces a ticket. He h it over, the MAN behind the counter looks up at Solo.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Just wait here a minute please, sir. The Man disappears. A beat or two later, the curtains of changing room part and there stands Sanders.

dialogues.speaker: SANDERS
dialogues.text: Good to see you Solo, so glad you could make it. You’ve come about thawing account number 583937994?

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: That was our deal.

dialogues.speaker: SANDERS
dialogues.text: Nothing to worry about, it can thaw. You just have to sign a few receipts first, you understand the bureaucracy. Could you follow me? Sanders turns and walks away down a corridor, Solo follow INT. DEL FLORIO’S TAILORS - OFFICE - DAY Sanders pushes various forms in front of Solo.

dialogues.speaker: SANDERS
dialogues.text: That’s a good man. Just sign here, and here. Solo can't be bothered to read the forms and just signs a  114.

dialogues.speaker: SANDERS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You and the Russian did a good job back there Solo, a proper team, even our governments thought so. Wouldn’t it be good if all the jobs you had to do were for such a good cause? An organization consisting of agents of all nationalities. Sanders puts more forms in front of Solo.

dialogues.speaker: SANDERS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just a few more.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: Great idea sir, but it would never happen. Anyway what would you call it?

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: As in my father’s brother? What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: SANDERS
dialogues.text: The United Network Command For Law and Enforcement.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: Sounds like you've been thinking about it sir. Of course, you’d need the Russian, and the girl was pretty useful as well.

dialogues.speaker: SANDERS
dialogues.text: I am sure that could be arranged.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: I'll believe it when I seen it. He continues signing.

dialogues.speaker: SANDERS
dialogues.text: Would you? What if I’d told you, you'd be the head agent, and you’d only commit to missions that were a global threat? No paperwork, and no politics.  115.

dialogues.speaker: SOLO
dialogues.text: Very entertaining sir. In that case, you'd have my attention. I'd be your man. Sanders looks relieved and takes away the last paper that Solo was signing. He checks the signature and blows it dr

dialogues.speaker: SANDERS
dialogues.text: I was hoping you’d say that, because the Russian put some money on you saying “yes.” I, as you know, am a bit more cynical. I said I'd need to see your signature first, but it seems we were both right. He presses a button, and the wall of clothes behind Sande disappears. We reveal -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kuryakin and Gaby are sitting with Waverly and Oleg, in f of a bank of computers and monitors, all staring at where Solo is sitting. Solo’s eyes are wide in shock.

dialogues.speaker: KURYAKIN
dialogues.text: And they even said you can fly first class. Good to see you, Cowboy.
